events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th involving a sedan and a truck at a stoplight intersection.
Upon review, the claim was classified under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured’s car in a collision.
An experienced claims agent named Sarah Johnson was assigned to handle the claim for prompt and efficient service.
The claim was formally acknowledged and confirmation sent to the insured outlining next steps and documentation needed.
The insured was requested to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and the repair estimate.
All requested documents were received including the police report and comprehensive repair estimate from the garage.
The investigation team began assessing incident details and verifying information provided by the insured and third parties.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured was not at fault and damages are eligible for coverage.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to cover full repair costs and minor personal property damage inside the vehicle.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the settlement amount and the clear, timely communication throughout process.
The claim was officially approved following the insured’s acceptance of the settlement proposal without conditions.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued directly to the insured’s bank account as per their request.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation of payment and receipt of completion documents for the vehicle repairs.
All claim documentation was archived in accordance with company policy to allow future reference if necessary.
